intro: Clidemia dependens, commonly known as the hanging mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, often pink or white flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Clidemia dependens is also known for its ability to form dense mats, which can contribute to soil stabilization in its natural habitat.
